title: Consensus Mirage
outcome: The city holds a public vote on the new BCI protocol, promoted as a breakthrough in citizen-led governance. But behind the scenes, the vote is manipulated—votes from high-score citizens are weighted, and dissent is sidelined. When whistleblowers leak evidence of the deception, public trust is shattered, sparking new forms of digital activism and eroding Council legitimacy.

events.description: Citywide voting process on the new BCI protocol begins, heavily promoted on all official channels as a historic moment of civic participation.
Technical staff notice irregularities in the vote-counting system: votes from high-score individuals appear to carry more influence. Some technicians quietly capture evidence.
Whistleblowers leak proof of voting manipulation; encrypted forums and citizen broadcasts spread the data, igniting outrage among previously hopeful participants.
Protests erupt across the city, focusing on lack of transparency and continued manipulation by the Council. Calls for creation of a parallel decision-making platform surge.
The Council issues a defensive statement claiming technical errors, but most citizens are unconvinced. A surge of new grassroots digital forums emerges as alternatives to official platforms.
